hypothesis_content.title: Bull-to-Stress Transition via Volatility Compression Break
hypothesis_content.statement: In BULL regimes, when 10-day realized volatility for BTC compresses to below 30% (annualized) while open interest reaches 90-day highs and the futures premium (BTC quarterly futures basis) exceeds 15%, a breakout from compression will trigger a STRESS regime within 2-4 days, favoring volatility expansion plays.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low volatility + high leverage (OI) + excessive optimism (high basis) creates a fragile equilibrium in bull markets. Any catalyst breaking the compression typically triggers violent deleveraging and volatility explosion, characteristic of STRESS regimes.
entry_conditions: BTC price breaks 5-day ATR range by 1.5x

exit_conditions.take_profit: VIX of crypto (CVOL) increases by 40% from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Volatility compression continues for 5 more days without breakout

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout occurs but volatility remains contained, or market transitions directly to BEAR without STRESS phase.
